alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:48AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Cowley, Sedgwick, Butler and northern Sumner Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Viola to 8 miles northwest of Grenola. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, El Dorado, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Goddard, Rose Hill, Maize, Clearwater, Cheney, Douglass, Sedgwick, Belle Plaine, Towanda and Colwich. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 22. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 24 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for south central and southeastern Kansas.
